scenario_text.value:
How could they do something like this?
I can’t understand it...
I can’t forgive any of it!

The Master, for what he’s done...and myself,
for those I couldn’t save...

(I’ve never seen Aoi this pissed off. She’s
giving herself a hard time.)

(I understand how she feels—painfully so,
even. Still...)

(I also get the feeling we’ll be in bad shape
if we don’t keep our heads here.)
(What should I say to Aoi?)
Don’t blame yourself.
I feel the same way.
Calm down a little.
Don’t blame yourself.

You’re blaming yourself too much, Aoi. That
won’t help anything...
But if I’d been faster, maybe I could’ve—!

No one could foresee things turning out this
way.

Instead of focusing on the past, we have to
push forward now!

That’s true... I’m sorry, I...got too carried
away.
I feel the same way.

I know exactly how you feel, Aoi. I...can’t
forgive them for what they’ve done.
Takuma...

If I’d returned to this world earlier, Miyuki
wouldn’t be in this state, either...

Hey, that’s not your fault, Takuma! There’s
nothing you could’ve done!

If that’s how you feel, then give yourself
a break too, okay?
Ah... Well, I...

I get that your sense of responsibility
extends even to yourself.

Still, I wish you would rely on us a little
more. We’re friends, after all.
Right... Thank you, Takuma.
Calm down a little.
You need to calm down, Aoi.

I understand your feelings, but anger won’t
solve anything here.

Plus... What’s done is done. Regret won’t
change that.
What a heartless thing to say, Takuma!

Sorry. But we need to keep it together if
we’re gonna stop the Master!

Ah...yes, you’re right. I’m sorry... I have
to stay strong, don’t I.

(Damn... I think I made her feel even worse
somehow...)

At any rate, we should do what we can at the
moment.
We have to keep it together here!

It’ll take a lot of hard work if we’re going
to save everyone!
